org.pac4j.core.client

Class BaseClient<C extends Credentials,U extends CommonProfile>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pac4j.core.util.InitializableWebObject
      • org.pac4j.core.client.BaseClient<C,U>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Client<C,U>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectClient, IndirectClient

    public abstract class BaseClient<C extends Credentials,U extends CommonProfile>
extends InitializableWebObject
implements Client<C,U>, Cloneable

    This class is the default implementation of an authentication client (whatever the protocol). It has the core concepts:

    • The initialization process is handled by the InitializableWebObject inheritance, the InitializableWebObject.internalInit(WebContext) must be implemented in sub-classes. The InitializableWebObject.init(WebContext) method must be called implicitly by the main methods of the Client interface, so that no explicit call is required to initialize the client
    • The cloning process is handled by the clone() method, the newClient() method must be implemented in sub-classes to create a new instance
    • The name of the client is handled through the setName(String) and getName() methods
    • The getClientType() method returns the implemented ClientType by the client.
    • After retrieving the user profile, the client can generate the authorization information (roles, permissions and remember-me) by using the appropriate AuthorizationGenerator.
    Since:
    1.4.0
    Author:
    Jerome Leleu
